---
title: Accessible Astro Starter
description: A minimal, accessible starter theme for your Astro projects.
---

import { Aside, Steps, FileTree, Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

## Introduction

The [Accessible Astro Starter](https://github.com/incluud/accessible-astro-starter) is a ready-to-use, SEO and accessibility-friendly blogging theme. It provides a solid foundation with numerous accessible components, Tailwind CSS integration, and example pages including a dynamic blog, 404 page, and MDX support. Version 4.0.0 introduces a complete design system overhaul with OKLCH colors, Atkinson Hyperlegible font, and significant accessibility improvements.

<div class="flex gap-2 mb-8">
  <a href="https://github.com/incluud/accessible-astro-starter" class="sl-flex">GitHub Repository</a>
  <a href="https://accessible-astro-starter.incluud.dev/" class="sl-flex">Live Demo</a>
</div>

## Key features

- Built on Astro 5.7.5
- Tailwind CSS 4.0 integration
- Modern OKLCH color system with light/dark mode
- Atkinson Hyperlegible font for improved readability
- Markdown and MDX support with examples included
- Excellent Lighthouse/PageSpeed scores
- ESLint with strict accessibility settings
- Prettier integration with plugins for Astro and Tailwind
- View Transitions support
- Dynamic blog with pagination and breadcrumbs using AJAX fetch
- Enhanced portfolio page with rich media support
- Custom 404 error page
- TypeScript interfaces and proper prop typing

## Accessibility features

- Semantic HTML landmarks (`header`, `main`, `footer`, `nav`, etc.)
- Proper heading hierarchy
- ARIA attributes for enhanced screen reader support
- Keyboard-accessible navigation with dropdown support
- Skip links for main menu and content
- Dark mode with system preference detection
- Focus indicators that work on all backgrounds
- Reduced motion preferences support
- Screen reader only text utilities
- Accessible components like Accordions, Breadcrumbs, Modals, and more
- Color Contrast Checker component for accessibility testing
- Modern CSS with logical properties

<Aside type="tip" title="Best practice">
  The theme follows WCAG guidelines and includes ESLint rules to help maintain accessibility standards in your code.
</Aside>

## Getting started

<Steps>
1. Clone the repository:
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/incluud/accessible-astro-starter.git
   ```

2. Install dependencies:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. Start development server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

4. Open your browser:
   Visit `http://localhost:4321` to see your site in action.
</Steps>

<Aside type="tip" title="GitHub template">
  The starter is also available as a GitHub template. You can use it to create a new project by clicking the "Use this template" button in the repository.
</Aside>

## Project structure

The starter follows a clear and organized structure:

<FileTree>
- public/
  - fonts/
  - ... // Other assets
- src/
  - assets/
    - img/ // Contains the logo
    - scss/
      - base/ _// Core styles and utilities_
  - components/
    - CallToAction.astro
    - ContentMedia.astro
    - Counter.astro
    - Feature.astro
    - Footer.astro
    - Header.astro
    - Hero.astro
    - Navigation.astro
    - ResponsiveToggle.astro
    - SiteMeta.astro
  - content/
    - projects/
      - project-01.md
      - project-02.md
      - project-03.md
      - project-04.md
      - project-05.md
      - project-06.md
      - project-07.md
  - layouts/
    - DefaultLayout.astro
    - MarkdownLayout.astro
  - pages/
    - blog/
      - [...page].astro _// Dynamic blog pages_
      - [post].astro _// Individual post pages_
    - portfolio/
      - [...page].astro
      - [project].astro
    - 404.astro
    - accessible-astro-components.astro
    - index.astro
    - markdown-page.md
    - mdx-page.mdx
- package.json
- astro.config.mjs
- tailwind.config.js
</FileTree>

## Available commands

| Command | Action |
|---------|--------|
| `npm install` | Install dependencies |
| `npm run dev` | Start dev server at `localhost:4321` |
| `npm run build` | Build for production |
| `npm run preview` | Preview production build |

## Components

The starter includes several pre-built accessible components, with several new additions in version 4.0.0:

#### Core Components
- `CallToAction.astro` - Styled block with a button
- `ContentMedia.astro` - Content with media layout
- `Counter.astro` - Icon and number counter
- `DarkMode.astro` - Theme toggle with system preference
- `Feature.astro` - Feature highlight component
- `Footer.astro` - With customizable content
- `Header.astro` - With responsive navigation
- `Hero.astro` - Hero section component
- `Navigation.astro` - Keyboard accessible dropdown navigation
- `ResponsiveToggle.astro` - Mobile navigation toggle
- `SiteMeta.astro` - SEO meta component
- `SkipLinks.astro` - For keyboard users

#### New in 4.0.0
- `ColorContrast.astro` - Accessibility testing component for color contrast
- `PageHeader.astro` - Consistent page titles component
- `Logo.astro` - Standardized branding component
- `ExternalLink.astro` - Link with proper external attributes
- `BlockQuote.astro` - Content citation component
- `BreakoutImage.astro` - Full-width image component
- `SocialShares.astro` - Blog post sharing component

<Aside type="note" title="View transitions">
  This theme supports Astro's View Transitions. Please review the [Astro documentation](https://docs.astro.build/en/guides/view-transitions/) for more information.
</Aside>

Extend or modify existing components in the `src/components` directory:

```astro
---
// src/components/Header.astro
import Navigation from './Navigation.astro'
---

<header>
  <Navigation />
  <!-- Add your custom header content -->
</header>
```

## Customization

### Styling

The theme uses Tailwind CSS with additional SCSS utilities. Customize your theme in the following files:

<FileTree>
- src/
  - assets/
    - scss/
      - base/
        - _reset.scss _// CSS reset_
        - _breakpoints.scss _// Media queries_
        - _buttons.scss _// Button styles_
        - _colors.scss _// Color system_
        - _font.scss _// Typography_
        - _outline.scss _// Focus styles_
        - _root.scss _// Custom properties_
</FileTree>

### Responsive Breakpoint System

The starter includes a powerful and versatile breakpoint mixin system using modern CSS media query syntax. The system supports min-width, max-width, and range queries with predefined breakpoints or custom values.

#### Available Breakpoints

```scss
$breakpoints: (
  'default': 0,
  'xs': 320px,
  's': 480px,
  'm': 768px,
  'l': 1024px,
  'xl': 1280px,
  '2xl': 1536px,
  'nav': 1000px,
)
```

#### Usage Examples

<Tabs>
  <TabItem label="Min-width (mobile-first)">
  ```scss
  // Apply styles from medium screens and up
  .component {
    @include breakpoint('m') {
      font-size: 1.2rem;
      padding: 2rem;
    }
  }

  // Output: @media (width >= 768px) { ... }
  ```
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem label="Max-width">
  ```scss
  // Apply styles below medium screens (mobile override)
  .component {
    @include breakpoint('m', 'max') {
      display: none;
    }
  }

  // Output: @media (width < 768px) { ... }
  ```
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem label="Range between breakpoints">
  ```scss
  // Apply styles only between medium and extra-large
  .component {
    @include breakpoint('m', 'xl') {
      grid-template-columns: repeat(2, 1fr);
    }
  }

  // Output: @media (768px <= width < 1280px) { ... }
  ```
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem label="Custom values">
  ```scss
  // Use custom pixel values
  .component {
    @include breakpoint(600px, 900px) {
      max-width: 80%;
    }
  }

  // Output: @media (600px <= width < 900px) { ... }
  ```
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem label="Explicit helpers">
  ```scss
  // Alternative syntax for clarity
  .component {
    @include breakpoint-min('m') { }  // Min-width
    @include breakpoint-max('l') { }  // Max-width
    @include breakpoint-between('m', 'xl') { } // Range
  }
  ```
  </TabItem>
</Tabs>

<Aside type="tip" title="Modern syntax">
  The breakpoint system uses modern CSS range syntax (`width >= 768px` instead of `min-width: 768px`), which is more readable and follows current CSS best practices. All modern browsers support this syntax.
</Aside>

### OKLCH Color System

Version 4.0.0 introduces a powerful OKLCH-based color system that makes it incredibly easy to create accessible color schemes. The best part? You only need to define your three brand colors, and the entire color palette is automatically generated!

<Tabs>
  <TabItem label="Simple Brand Color Setup">
  ```scss
  :root {
    // Just set these three brand colors in hex or any format
    --brand-primary: #d648ff;   // Your primary brand color
    --brand-secondary: #00d1b7; // Your secondary brand color
    --brand-neutral: #b9bec4;   // Your neutral brand color

    // The rest of the color palette is automatically generated!
  }
  ```
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem label="How it works">
  ```scss
  :root {
    // Your brand colors (these are the only ones you need to customize)
    --brand-primary: #d648ff;
    --brand-secondary: #00d1b7;
    --brand-neutral: #b9bec4;

    // Automatic generation of primary palette with 5 variations
    --color-primary-100: oklch(from var(--brand-primary) 90% c h); // Lightest
    --color-primary-200: oklch(from var(--brand-primary) 80% c h);
    --color-primary-300: oklch(from var(--brand-primary) 70% c h);
    --color-primary-400: oklch(from var(--brand-primary) 60% c h);
    --color-primary-500: oklch(from var(--brand-primary) 50% c h); // Darkest

    // Secondary color palette is generated the same way
    --color-secondary-100: oklch(from var(--brand-secondary) 90% c h);
    // ... and so on

    // Neutral palette for text, backgrounds, etc.
    --color-neutral-100: oklch(from var(--brand-neutral) 100% 0 0); // White
    --color-neutral-200: oklch(from var(--brand-neutral) 95% c h);
    // ... through to:
    --color-neutral-900: oklch(from var(--brand-neutral) 15% c h); // Near black

    // Automatic light/dark mode handling
    --foreground-color: light-dark(var(--color-neutral-800), var(--color-neutral-100));
    --background-color: light-dark(var(--color-neutral-100), var(--color-neutral-900));
    --link-color: light-dark(var(--color-primary-400), var(--color-secondary-100));
    // ... and more
  }

  // Dark mode is handled automatically
  .darkmode {
    color-scheme: dark;
  }
  ```
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem label="Example customization">
  ```scss
  // In your _root.scss or a new SCSS file

  :root {
    // Just update these three values to transform your entire theme
    --brand-primary: #4a6cf7;    // Blue
    --brand-secondary: #f7724a;  // Orange
    --brand-neutral: #94a3b8;    // Slate

    // All of your theme colors will automatically adjust!
  }
  ```
  </TabItem>
</Tabs>

The magic of this system is how it leverages OKLCH color transformations to create consistent, harmonious color palettes with proper contrast for accessibility. OKLCH (Lightness, Chroma, Hue) is a perceptually uniform color space that makes it easier to create accessible color combinations.

<Aside type="tip" title="Easy theming">
  By changing just three brand colors, you can completely transform your site's theme while maintaining accessibility. The system automatically handles light/dark mode, contrast, and creates a full color palette with multiple shades.
</Aside>

<Aside type="caution" title="Verify accessibility">
  While OKLCH helps create better color palettes, always verify your customized colors with the Color Contrast Checker component included in the starter. Accessibility is not automatically guaranteed when customizing colors, especially for text and interactive elements that need to meet WCAG contrast requirements.
</Aside>

## Contributing

<Steps>
1. Fork the repository on GitHub

2. Create a new branch:
   ```bash
   git checkout -b feat/your-feature-name
   ```

3. Make your changes and commit them:
   ```bash
   git commit -m "Add some feature"
   ```

4. Push to your fork:
   ```bash
   git push origin feat/your-feature-name
   ```

5. Open a Pull Request on GitHub
</Steps>

<Aside type="tip" title="Getting help">
  If you find any issues or have questions, please open an issue on GitHub or start a discussion in the repository. You can also reach out to the Astro community on Discord.
</Aside>
